resources.string: "OSBuild need get root permission to read this file, are you sure to continue? \nNotice: + It\'s NOT a problem with OSBuild if you see nothing then. You should make sure that your device has been rooted and you have authorized OSBuild's request for root permission. + OSBuild just do what should do with root permission."

"OSBuild - FOR ANDROID DEVELOPERS 
Ever wanted to peek inside and know more about your device? Well, OSBuild, a simple, lightweight, clean and beautiful app, meets your needs. And it works on all phones running Android 2.2 and above! 
A simple UI and some nice features make it great tool especially for Android developers and learners. 
Features + List RICH RAW info about the device with keeping most programming words. + Provide RICH related data, like "19 KITKAT 4.4 2013-10 39.3% 19". + List all features the system supported, such as "FEATURE_USB_HOST". + Expose details of installed apps, including SIGNATURE. + OPEN SOURCE. You can see its source codes on GitHub to get useful code sections. (https://github.com/by-syk/OSBuild) 
Modules + Primer + Build + Display + Telephony + CPU + Memory + Package + Sensor + Superuser + App + etc. 
PS: Maybe OSBuild could help you with smartphone reviews. 
Salute to Sony Xperia AppXplore."
"Any BUGs, mistakes, suggestion or confusion, feedback by E-mail or revise on a market. I would take to heart. \nYour voice can make a difference!"

"Not financially. 
Just "Share the Page" to me by E-mail or any other available way. As you can see, only some hardware info about the device (NO PRIVACY). 
Each received file helps me expand the OSBuild - DAD (Database of Android Devices). 
I've spent plenty of time programming. If you find OSBuild useful, please help me a lot. Thank you."
